Teaching Point
   To iden tify verb b ased words us ed to indica te the time a nd the co mpletenes s of an action at the time o f speaking.
Sentenc es
1. Raj climbs  on the mango tree every day.
2. Raj climbed  on the mango tree yesterday.
3. Raj will climb  on the mango tr ee tomor row.
Conc epts
1. Sentence-1 expr esses an action happening in the presen t time , everyday, always etc.
2. Sentence-2 expr esses an ac tion happening in the past time , yesterday, a year ago et c.
3. Sentence-3 expr esses an action that is likely to happen in futur e, tomor row, next day etc.
Tense is a verb- based word that deno tes the time of action. EMPO WER
Present tense
Struc ture: S ubject + base form of the verb (VI) + object. ‘S’ or ‘es’ is added to the verb in the 
third person singular pronouns and nouns .
Use:  a. to expr ess  a periodic or regular action.
 b. to expr ess habits or gener al truths or sta ting a fac t.
Examples  a. I usually go ﬁshing on weekends . (Usual)
b. He knows the answ er. (action in presen t time)
c. She nev er puts  milk in her tea. (regular action)
d. The ear th goes  round the sun. (stating a fact)
e. I spider has six legs . (gener al truth)17Tenses
68 Grammar -5

Past tense
Struc ture: Subjec t + verb in the past form (V2) + objec t
Use:  a. to indica te complet ed actions in the past
 b. to indica te ev ents in the past
 c. in the nar ration of st ories and new s.
Examples  a. I enjo yed lunch with my family yesterday.
 b. We went shopping for Diw ali.
 c. Onc e upon a time , a king  happily in his palac e. lived
Futur e tense
Struc ture: S + will + verb in the base form (VI) + objec t.
Use: a.    to indica te an ac tion, c ondition or cir cumstanc e which hasn ’t taken plac e yet 
but will take plac e in futur e.
 b. to expr ess ac tions likely t o happen in futur e.
Examples  a.  I will bake  a cake in the ev ening .
 b.    He  will look  into the ma tter.
 c.  I hope her c ondition will impr ove in the nex t twelve hours .

(work)

10. She ___________ t he ﬂo or with a w et m op. (sweep)

70Grammar -5

CONTINUOUS OR PROGRESSIVE TENSE
Teaching P oint
   To iden tify verb b ased words us ed to sho w the co ntinuity of the ac tion at the time o f speaking.
Sentenc es
1. The birds are ﬂying  in the sk y.
2. He is learning  comput ers.
3. The childr en were enjo ying  the cir cus.
4. The clo wn was doing  amusing an tics.
5. They will be going  to the z oo.
Conc epts
1. Sentence 1 and 2 e xpress an ac tion tha t is c ontinuing or going on a t the time of speak ing.
2.  S entence 3 and 4 express an action showing a continuing or ongoing action in the past.
3. Sentence 5 expr esses an ac tion tha t will be going ar ound a par ticular time in the futur e.
EMPO WER
Presen t continuous Futur e Past
Examples  1. It is raining  hea vily.
 2. The bo ys are pla ying  video games . 
 3. I am watching  a ﬁlm on TV no w.Present Progr essiv e
Tense
71Grammar -5

Struc ture: S + is/am/ar e + verb + ing +objec t.
Use:  1. It refers to uncomplet ed action that is happening in the presen t time . 
 2.  I t shows action that is continuing presently i.e. around now- a little before, 
during and a little after the momen t.
Past Pr ogr essiv e Tense
Struc ture: Subjec t + was /were + verb + ing + objec t.
Use: 1. It  indica tes an action going on for a period of time around a particular past    
time . 
Presen t
Past continuousPast Past
Examples 1. We were playing  in the gar den when M om ar rived.
 2. I was mak ing a cake when y ou called .
 3. She was working in the gar den in the ev ening .
2. Action continues till a certain time in the past.
Futur e Pr ogr essiv e Tense
Struc ture: Subjec t + shall /will + be + verb + ing
Use: 1. It  indica tes that something will be in progress (going on) at a particular 
momen t in the futur e. 
Examples 1.  Good luck ! We'll be think ing of you.
 2.
 3. 2. To refer to futur e events which are ﬁxed or decided .
You soon will be hear ing from my lawyer.
Dr. Rashi will be giving another lecture next week at the same time .

73Grammar -5

PERFECT TENSE
Teaching P oint
   To iden tify verb-b ased word used to indica te the co mpletenes s of an action at the time o f speaking.
Sentenc es
1. The childr en have just ﬁnished  their mor ning assembly .
2. He has ﬁnished  his pr ayers.
3. The childr en had ﬁnished
4. The childr en will ha ve ﬁnished  their tut orials b y 8 o ’ clock .
Conc epts
1.  S entences 1 and 2 express actions that started in the past but are completed in the present 
time . It is the presen t perfect tense .
2.  S entence 3 expr esses an action that was complet ed by a certain time in the past. It is past 
perfect tense .
3. Sentence 4 expr esses an ac tion tha t will be c omplet ed b y a c ertain time in the futur e.
EMPO WER
Present Perfect Tense
 their ph ysical tr aining bef ore 8’ clock .
Struc ture: 1. Subjec t + have + verb in the third form (V3) + objec t.
For 3r d person singular 2. Subjec t + has + V3 + objec t.
Use:  1.   A n action or situation that started in the past and still continues 
in the presen t and has just complet ed.
 2.   I t tells us about an action, incident or happening which has just 
complet ed at the time of speak ing.
74Grammar -5

Past Perfect Tense
Struc ture : Subjec t + had + V3 + objec t
Use:  1.    It indica tes that an action was complet ed at some poin t in the 
past
 2. To talk about an action that happened before a past event
Example: 1.  She had gone  to meet her g randmother , but she w as not a t 
home .
 2. The audienc e had taken  their sea ts bef ore the sho w star ted.
 3. By the time w e arrived, the r ecital had  already started.

6. My mother ____________ a lways ____________ (t each) m e to live in dis cipline.
7.   e sailors ____________ a lready ____________ (le ave) for the sea before the 
announcement of the storm. 3. It does not specify the exact period between the past and now.
Example:  1. They have already resolv ed the matter themselv es.
 2. I have just read my holy book . It has blessed  me.
